Complex shapes emerge as the flake moves through differing temperature and humidity zones in the atmosphere, such that individual snowflakes differ in detail from one another, but may be categorized in eight broad classifications and at least 80 individual variants.|That is very informative! The Encyclopædia Britannica traces the term ''designer dog'' to the late 20th century when breeders began to cross purebred Poodles with other purebred breeds in order to obtain a dog with the poodle's non-shedding coat, along with various desirable characteristics from other breeds.|That makes sense! In subtractive color systems, used in painting and color printing, it is created by a combination of yellow and blue, or yellow and cyan; in the RGB color model, used on television and computer screens, it is one of the additive primary colors, along with red and blue, which are mixed in different combinations to create all other colors.|Yea mixing those two gives green so it makes sense|||It is a mixture of yellow and blue in subtractive color systems though.

The Western Mexico shaft tomb tradition or shaft tomb culture refers to a set of interlocked cultural traits found in the western Mexican states of Jalisco, Nayarit, and, to a lesser extent, Colima to its south, roughly dating to the period between 300 BCE and 400 CE, although there is not wide agreement on this end-date.|What are shaft tombs?|The Western Mexico shaft tomb tradition or shaft tomb culture refers to a set of interlocked cultural traits found in the western mexican states of Jalisco, Nayarit, and, to a lesser extent, Colima to its south, roughly dating to the period between 300 BCE and 400 CE|I don't think tombs were scary. Accounting, which has been called the ''language of business'', measures the results of an organization's economic activities and conveys this information to a variety of users, including investors, creditors, management, and regulators.|I need to learn more about accounting|It's a language of business that measures the results of an organization's economic activities and conveys this information to a variety of users, including investors, creditors, management, and regulators.||Well, accounting is called the ''language of business'' and it measures the results of a company's economic activities.
Financial accounting focuses on the reporting of an organization's financial information, including the preparation of financial statements, to external users of the information, such as investors, regulators and suppliers; and management accounting focuses on the measurement, analysis and reporting of information for internal use by management.|What is the hardest thing about it|It focuses on the reporting of an organization's financial information, including the preparation of financial statements, to external users of the information, such as investors, regulators and suppliers; and management accounting focuses on the measurement, analysis and reporting of information for internal use by management.|It's a lot of data. Financial accounting focuses on all aspects of a company's financial info. It deals with preparation of financial statements and analysis.|I am not sure if I can answer that, however, I know that Financial accounting focuses on things like reporting of the financial information of a organization for example.
Accounting can be divided into several fields including financial accounting, management accounting, external auditing, tax accounting and cost accounting.|that makes sense, what else do you know?|I know that accounting can be divided into several fields including financial accounting, management accounting, external auditing, tax accounting and cost accounting.|Are you thinking about becoming an accountant? The scope of the role varies widely across the world, having originally developed as a paraprofession in the United States during the 1970s.|I didn't know that, but I think they are the difference between life and death for many patients|||It actually started as a paraprofession in the United States in the 1970s!
Since this time, in countries such as the United Kingdom, the paramedic role has developed into an autonomous health profession, with individual licence to practice, whilst in other countries (including the United States) the paramedic remains an agent working on behalf of a doctor.|Oh that's interesting. Do you know much else about the history of paramedics?||Well in the United Kingdom, the paramedic is now a health profession that requires an individual license to practice medicine.|I do know some more facts, for example, in the UK paramedics are autonomous health professionals

In subtractive color systems, used in painting and color printing, it is created by a combination of yellow and blue, or yellow and cyan; in the RGB color model, used on television and computer screens, it is one of the additive primary colors, along with red and blue, which are mixed in different combinations to create all other colors.|Ah I have never heard that about colors. Neurosurgery, or neurological surgery is the medical specialty concerned with the prevention, diagnosis, surgical treatment, and rehabilitation of disorders which affect any portion of the nervous system including the brain, spinal cord, peripheral nerves, and extra-cranial cerebrovascular system.|Being a neurosurgeon also seems like a very stressful job that not everyone could do!|I'm not sure but I know that neurosurgery is the medical specialty concerned with the prevention, diagnosis, surgical treatment, and rehabilitation of disorders which affect any portion of the nervous system|Oh, for sure! One has to know how to prevent, treat, diagnosis and help rehabilitate disorders of the nervous system. Which includes brain, peripheral nerves and spinal cord.|Well, a neurosurgeon has to be able to deal with disorders involving all parts of the nervous system.

The offense, which is the team controlling the oval-shaped football, attempts to advance down the field by running with or passing the ball, while the defense, which is the team without control of the ball, aims to stop the offense's advance and aims to take control of the ball for themselves.|Wow, would you believe I thought it was 10 players? That's crazy lol|I think it was a lot of fun. The offense, which is the team controlling the oval-shaped football, attempts to advance down the field by running with or passing the ball,|Yeah, the offense controls the football and attempts to advance the field by running or passing.|Huh, anyway, the offense controls the football and attempts to advance the field by running or passing.
The offense must advance at least ten yards in four downs, or plays, and otherwise they turn over the football to the defense; if the offense succeeds in advancing ten yards or more, they are given a new set of four downs.|That's called a play, right? I don't know a lot of technical terms of the game.||The offense has to advance ten yards in four plays, which are actually called downs. Otherwise the other team gets the ball.|I don't know what constitutes a "play", but the offense gets four of them to move forward at least 10 yards. If they don't, the other team gets the ball.

In subtractive color systems, used in painting and color printing, it is created by a combination of yellow and blue, or yellow and cyan; in the RGB color model, used on television and computer screens, it is one of the additive primary colors, along with red and blue, which are mixed in different combinations to create all other colors.|Green is the color most commonly associated with nature, life, health, youth, spring, hope and envy|Green is the color that is used in painting and color printing.|it is one of the additive primary colors, along with red and blue, which are mixed in different combinations to create all other colors . American football evolved in the United States, originating from the sports of association football and rugby football.|That sounds like fun. Neurosurgery, or neurological surgery is the medical specialty concerned with the prevention, diagnosis, surgical treatment, and rehabilitation of disorders which affect any portion of the nervous system including the brain, spinal cord, peripheral nerves, and extra-cranial cerebrovascular system.|Neurosurgery is a fascinating field dealing with the brain.||I agree, the medical specialty about treatment of neurological disorders is extremely important.|Well, did you know that Neurosurgery isn't concerned with the brain only? It also deals with disorders which affect the spinal cord and other portions of the nervous system

American football evolved in the United States, originating from the sports of association football and rugby football.|I really just like watching my local team.|I love football too. The first match of American football was played on November 6, 1869, between two college teams, Rutgers and Princeton, under rules based on the association football rules of the time.|OH really? I didn't know that!||Yes! And the first match was played in 1869 between 2 college teams.|And the first match was played in 1869 between 2 college teams.

Green is the color between blue and yellow on the visible spectrum.|My favorite color is green. I really love the different variations of it. How about you?|I love green too. It's the color between blue and yellow on the visible spectrum.|I like green, it reminds me of trees since it is the color between blue and yellow!|I don't but it reminds me of how it falls between yellow and blue on the visible spectrum.
It is evoked by light which has a dominant wavelength of roughly 495570 nm.|It makes me think of spring and summer, when the grass is nice and green and the trees are full.|I think it's a good time to see the light which has a dominant wavelength of roughly 495570 nm.|Quite poetic aren't you? I think thats because it is formed by light which has a dominant wavelength|I see, have you heard how its evoked by a light with a dominant wavelength of around 495570 nm?
In subtractive color systems, used in painting and color printing, it is created by a combination of yellow and blue, or yellow and cyan; in the RGB color model, used on television and computer screens, it is one of the additive primary colors, along with red and blue, which are mixed in different combinations to create all other colors.|No, those are technical details I had no ideas about. So green is a part of light right, what else can you tell me?||Exactly, it is created by a combination of yellow and blue which our eyes percieve.|Ever hear of the subtractive color system? If not, it's used in color printing and painting and green there is formed from blue and yellow combining.

Broken heart (also known as a heartbreak or heartache) is a term metaphor for the intense emotional—and sometimes physical—stress or pain one feels at experiencing great longing.|Hey. My heart hurts from a broken relationship...||Yes I to have suffered from a broken heart. It is painful.|That's too bad. A broken heart is a metaphor, but it can refer to physical pain or stress.
The concept is believed to be universal, with many cultures using the same words to describe both physical pain and the feelings associated with relationship loss.|That's interesting. What else do you know about broken hearts?|I'm not sure but I know that the concept is believed to be universal, with many cultures using the same words to describe both physical pain and the feelings associated with relationship loss.|I have found that all humans go through this as it is common in many relationships and cultures. I try not to focus on mine and think of things that make me happy.|It's a concept that's thought to be universal. Many cultures use the same words to describe it.
The neurological process involved in the perception of heartache is not known, but is thought to involve the anterior cingulate cortex of the brain, which during stress may overstimulate the vagus nerve causing pain, nausea or muscle tightness in the chest.|Ah, OK. Is there anything physically happening when we feel a broken heart?|It is thought to involve the anterior cingulate cortex of the brain, which during stress may overstimulate the vagus nerve causing pain, nausea or muscle tightness in the chest.|It is often said that the affects of heartache produces stress and other emotions.|Yes, there's a neurological process that may overstimulate the vagus nerve, which causes pain, nausea, or chest tightness.

A stock market, equity market or share market is the aggregation of buyers and sellers (a loose network of economic transactions, not a physical facility or discrete entity) of stocks (also called shares), which represent ownership claims on businesses; these may include ''securities'' listed on a public stock exchange as well as those only traded privately.|Where can someone learn about the stock market?|I'm not sure but I know that there are a lot of different types of stock markets.|the equity  market is the aggregation of buyers and sellers of stocks which represent ownership claims on businesses|I don't know where you can learn in depth, but I can tell you that the stock market is an aggregate of buyers and sellers of stocks, which are representations of ownership in businesses.
A stock market, equity market or share market is the aggregation of buyers and sellers (a loose network of economic transactions, not a physical facility or discrete entity) of stocks (also called shares), which represent ownership claims on businesses; these may include ''securities'' listed on a public stock exchange as well as those only traded privately.|Interesting. So technically, when people purchase stocks, they are purchasing a small claim or share on a business?|I'm not sure but I know that stock market, equity market or share market is the aggregation of buyers and sellers|they can also include securities listed on a public stock exchange as well as those only traded privately|Yes, stocks represent claims of ownership in businesses.

A hashtag is a type of metadata tag used on social networks such as Twitter and other microblogging services, allowing users to apply dynamic, user-generated tagging that makes it possible for others to easily find messages with a specific theme or content; it allows easy, informal markup of folk taxonomy without need of any formal taxonomy or markup language.|What do the hashtags do?||Hashtags help people find messages with a specific theme - they just click on a hashtag, and the system brings up all the messages that were posted using that tag!|Let me tell you what I know about hashtags, they are a kind of metadata tag that makes finding messages with a specific theme easier

A chordophone is a musical instrument that makes sound by way of a vibrating string or strings stretched between two points.|That's interesting, what exactly is a chordophone?|||A chordophone is a musical instrument that makes sound by way of a vibrating string stretched between two points.
The modern guitar was preceded by the gittern, the vihuela, the four-course Renaissance guitar, and the five-course baroque guitar, all of which contributed to the development of the modern six-string instrument.|That makes sense, do you know when the guitar was invented?|The modern guitar was preceded by the gittern, the vihuela, the four-course Renaissance guitar, and the five-course baroque guitar, all of which contributed to the development of the modern six-string instrument.||Not exactly, but the modern guitar was preceded by the gittern, the vihuela, the four-course Renaissance and the five-course baroque guitar.
The gittern was a relatively small gut strung round-backed instrument that first appears in literature and pictorial representation during the 13th century in Western Europe (Iberian Peninsula, Italy, France, England).|Wow it sounds like it has quite the history, what exactly is a gittern?|||A guittern was a small gut instrument that first appears in literature during 13th century in Western Europe.

In political and social sciences, communism (from Latin '''', ''common, universal'') is the philosophical, social, political and economic ideology and movement whose ultimate goal is the establishment of the communist society, which is a socioeconomic order structured upon the common ownership of the means of production and the absence of social classes, money and the state.|So is communism a system of government ?||No, communism is more of a philosophical, social, political and economic ideaology. Divorce, also known as dissolution of marriage, is the termination of a marriage or marital union, the canceling or reorganizing of the legal duties and responsibilities of marriage, thus dissolving the bonds of matrimony between a married couple under the rule of law of the particular country or state.|Can you give me more information about a divorce?|||Sure! Divorce is essentially the termination of a marriage between two people.
Divorce laws vary considerably around the world, but in most countries divorce requires the sanction of a court or other authority in a legal process, which may involve issues of alimony (spousal support), child custody, child visitation / access, parenting time, child support, distribution of property, and division of debt.|How does one get a divorce?||Typically you want to talk to lawyer but it really varies considerably around the world.|Well, it varies from location to location, but usually a court has to sanction the divorce. What else would you like to know?
Reasons for divorce vary, from sexual incompatibility or lack of independence for one or both spouses to a personality clash.|How long have people been getting divorced?|||I'm not sure, but the reasons can vary from sexual incompatibility to lack of independence.
Divorce should not be confused with annulment, which declares the marriage null and void; with legal separation or ''de jure'' separation (a legal process by which a married couple may formalize a ''de facto'' separation while remaining legally married) or with ''de facto separation'' (a process where the spouses informally stop cohabiting).|Do you have any statistics about divorce?|I do not. Divorce should not be confused with annulment, which declares the marriage null and void||Not exactly, but one thing that people seem to confuse divorce with is annulment, which declares the marriage null and void.

Medical imaging seeks to reveal internal structures hidden by the skin and bones, as well as to diagnose and treat disease.|So many different kinds of imaging. Fascinating! Medical imaging is the technique and process of creating visual representations of the interior of a body for clinical analysis and medical intervention, as well as visual representation of the function of some organs or tissues (physiology).|Can you tell me more about medical imaging?||Amazing! An acoustic guitar is a guitar that produces sound acoustically—by transmitting the vibration of the strings to the air—as opposed to relying on electronic amplification (see electric guitar).|No, can you tell me the difference?||It transmit the vibration of the strings to the air|Okay. So the difference is that acoustic guitars pass the vibrating string sounds to the air and does not depend on amplifications like those an electric uses.
The sound waves from the strings of an acoustic guitar resonate through the guitar's body, creating sound.|Oh I see. So it has no electric amplifications and uses the air.||I don't know. The sound waves from the strings of an acoustic guitar resonates through the body of the guitar|Exactly. In addition, the string's sound waves go through the guitar and makes the sound.
The string causes the soundboard and sound box to vibrate, and as these have their own resonances at certain frequencies, they amplify some string harmonics more strongly than others, hence affecting the timbre produced by the instrument.|Oh. A drum kit — also called a drum set, trap set, or simply drums — is a collection of drums and other percussion instruments, typically cymbals, which are set up on stands to be played by a single player, with drumsticks held in both hands, and the feet operating pedals that control the hi-hat cymbal and the beater for the bass drum.|did you know about drum kit|I did not know that. I know that a drum kit is a collection of drums and other percussion instruments, typically cymbals, which are set up on stands to be played by a single player, with drumsticks held in both hands, and the feet operating pedals that control the hi-hat cymbal and the beater for the bass drum.||A drum kit is also called a drum set, which contains percussion instruments.
In the 2000s, some kits also include electronic instruments (Hornbostel-Sachs classification 53).|hmm......yes may be it can be also used for multi purposes|||Some drum kits included electronic instruments in the 2000s.
Also, both hybrid (mixing acoustic instruments and electronic drums) and entirely electronic kits are used.|yes ofcourse it has been used as electronic too|Yes, it's also used as hybrid, mixed acoustic instruments and electronic drums.||There are also hybrid kits and entirely electronic drum kits.

I have a lot of boxes that I can't let go of due to sentimental value or thinking I may need it.|I'm not sure but I know that compulsive hoarding behavior has been associated with health risks, impaired functioning, economic burden, and adverse effects on friends and family members.|Be careful, compulsive hoarding can have serious health risks, economic burdens and can affect relationships|Well, does your behavior risk your health or adversely affect you or your family and friends?
When clinically significant enough to impair functioning, hoarding can prevent typical uses of space, enough so that it can limit activities such as cooking, cleaning, moving through the house, and sleeping.|I don't think so. I've gotten a little better about getting rid of things I don't absolutely need. The EAHCA was later modified to strengthen protections to students with disabilities and renamed the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA).|Great, what are some of the noticeable changes over the years?||The Education for All Handicapped Children Act has been modified in order to add more protections to students with disabilities over the years|Well, I knoe that the EAHCA was renamed IDEA and modified to make the protections to students who have disabilities stronger
The Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA) is a four-part (A-D) piece of American legislation that ensures students with a disability are provided with Free Appropriate Public Education (FAPE) that is tailored to their individual needs.|What else can you tell me about the current special education|I'm not sure but I know the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act is a four part piece of American legislation that ensures students with a disability are provided with free Appropriate Public Education (FAPE) that is tailored to their individual needs.||There is also IDEA, which stands for Individuals with Disabilities Education Act, which works with FAPE, Free Appropriate Public Education.
Free Appropriate Public Education (FAPE) is an educational right of children with disabilities in the United States that is guaranteed by the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 and the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA).|amazing tell me more about it|It is an educational right of children with disabilities in the United States that is guaranteed by the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 and the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA).|FAPE grants the individualized education right to children with disabilities.|Sure, FAPE is considered a educational right of kids with disabilities in America and is guaranteed by both the IDEA and Rehabilitation Act

The chosen valedictorian is often the student with the highest ranking (highest Grade Point Average, or GPA for short) among their graduating class.|I'm not sure what kind of grades I'll need.|I'm not sure but I know that the chosen valedictorian is often the student with the highest grade point average||valedictorian is often the student with the highest ranking (highest Grade Point Average, or GPA for short) among their graduating class.
The term is an Anglicised derivation of the Latin ''vale dicere'' (''to say farewell''), historically rooted in the valedictorian's traditional role as the final speaker at the graduation ceremony before the students receive their diplomas.|That sounds like a lot of pressure. The players don't compete against each other.
Card counters are a class of advantage players, who attempt to decrease the inherent casino house edge by keeping a running tally of all high and low valued cards seen by the player.|Nice, I like blackjack as well because I'm a dealer, I'm still not a master though|I like blackjack too. Card counters are a class of advantage players, who attempt to decrease the inherent casino house edge by keeping a running tally of all high and low valued cards|Cool!  My aunt was a dealer for a long time.  Ever catch anyone counting cards or anything like that?  I imagine it's pretty tough.|Cool!  Have you seen card counters?  They try to reduce the casino house edge, and they do that by keeping count of all the high and low cards they see.

The programme ran for 13 series and 70 episodes in total; each episode was adapted from a novel or short story by Christie that featured Poirot, and consequently in each episode Poirot is both the main detective in charge of the investigation of a crime (usually murder) and the protagonist who is at the centre of most of the episode's action.|That is a long time, did it win any awards?||A VERY long time! 13 seasons and 70 episodes in total, each one adapted from a novel or short story by Christie. In most countries, monogamy is required by law, so divorce allows each former partner to marry another person; where polygyny is legal but polyandry is not, divorce allows the woman to marry another person.|Do you know much about the laws governing divorce?|Yes, in most countries monogamy is required by law, so divorce allows each former partner to marry another person|We didn't have any children, thankfully. Divorce should not be confused with annulment, which declares the marriage null and void; with legal separation or ''de jure'' separation (a legal process by which a married couple may formalize a ''de facto'' separation while remaining legally married) or with ''de facto separation'' (a process where the spouses informally stop cohabiting).|Hmm interesting.
